name: Muslim Aid America
mission: PROVIDE HELP TO PEOPLE WHO ARE VICTIMS OF NATURAL DISASTERS OR CONFLICTS OR SUFFERING FROM POVERTY, HUNGER, DISEASE, ILLITERACY, DISCRIMINATION, HOMELES...

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 39/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Build reserves toward your board-approved target range (often 3-12 months), adjusted for revenue volatility and obligations.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

score_details.score_summary: Muslim Aid America shows strong alignment and strong impact (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: CORROBORATION FAILED: Discovered via search (confidence=0.50) (Source: https://www.muslimaidusa.org/donate/)

all_citations.claim: The charity focuses on victims of disasters and poverty, maintaining a 93.2% program expense ratio and 2.1 months of working capital.
The organization reported total revenue of $26,177,076 and a fundraising efficiency of $0.04 per $1 raised.
The organization offers various donation methods for supporters to provide sadaqah and general charitable giving.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a solid score due to its high financial efficiency and direct service model, though its overall rating is tempered by modest liquidity reserves.
areas_for_improvement: Relatively lean working capital of 2.1 months, which may limit long-term financial cushioning.
Enhancing public impact reporting to provide more granular cost-per-beneficiary data.

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 39/50, the organization represents a high donor fit for those prioritizing urgent humanitarian relief and sadaqah-eligible projects [3]. Its mission addresses critical global needs including disaster response and poverty alleviation, which are considered high-urgency causes [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: The charity demonstrates a high commitment to direct service, allocating 93.2% of its $26,177,076 revenue directly to programs such as water wells and food security [1][2]. While it maintains a high data confidence level, specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics are not currently available to further validate its impact score of 35/50 [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: Muslim Aid America provides essential humanitarian relief to victims of natural disasters, conflict, and poverty through high-efficiency programming.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 93.2%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach those in need.
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.04 per $1 raised.
Strong focus on urgent humanitarian causes including food security and water access.
baseline_narrative.summary: Muslim Aid America is a humanitarian organization dedicated to assisting individuals suffering from hunger, disease, and illiteracy across the globe [1]. In the most recent fiscal year, the organization reported a total revenue of $26,177,076 to support its mission of providing emergency aid and long-term development [2]. Supporters can contribute to these efforts through various sadaqah-eligible giving options available on their platform [3].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a solid score due to its high financial efficiency and direct service model, though its overall rating is tempered by modest liquidity reserves.

areas_for_improvement.detail: The organization maintains <cite id="14">2.1 months of working capital</cite>, which is considered lean and may pose risks during revenue volatility.
While outcomes are verified, there is <cite id="15">no specific beneficiary data available</cite> to calculate a precise cost-per-beneficiary metric.

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization maintains audited financial statements and high transparency through Candid.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's rapid revenue growth may explain the lean reserves as funds are quickly deployed to active crisis zones.
risk_factors: <cite id="14">Working capital of 2.3 months</cite> is below the ideal 6-12 month safety margin.
<cite id="17">Absence of a formal Theory of Change</cite> document.
case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="14">limited financial reserves</cite> and a lack of granular impact data.

confidence.notes: Strong financial and transparency data available.

known_gaps: No formal Theory of Change document

alignment.explanation: The organization is a strong fit for Muslim donors due to its <cite id="19">Islamic identity</cite> and focus on <cite id="5">Muslim-majority regions</cite> facing extreme poverty and conflict.
alignment.improvement: The charity could improve alignment by <cite id="20">expanding services to underserved geographies</cite> with limited existing non-profit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="11">Candid Platinum Seal</cite> and a board composed of <cite id="13">100% independent members</cite>. The organization also maintains <cite id="16">audited financial statements</cite> to ensure fiscal accountability.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could <cite id="17">document a clear theory of change</cite> with an explicit causal pathway for its various interventions.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient with a <cite id="6">93.2% program expense ratio</cite> and a <cite id="18">direct service delivery model</cite> that bypasses unnecessary intermediaries.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="15">publishing consistent beneficiary counts</cite> to allow for comparative cost-effectiveness analysis.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Verified outcomes with limited cost-per-beneficiary data

rich_narrative.headline: Muslim Aid America provides essential humanitarian relief to victims of natural disasters, conflict, and poverty through high-efficiency programming.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize maximum financial efficiency and want their sadaqah to reach crisis zones with minimal administrative leakage.
donor_motivations: Want to ensure over 98% of their donation reaches the field
Care about rapid emergency response in the Muslim world
Value high-growth organizations with transparent reporting
Prefer supporting direct service over advocacy
giving_considerations: Donations are sadaqah-eligible but not currently processed as zakat
The organization operates with lean reserves, prioritizing immediate aid over long-term endowment
Impact is verified through outcomes but lacks detailed cost-per-person metrics
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors specifically looking to fulfill zakat obligations or those requiring rigorous RCT-level evidence of long-term economic shifts.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that while <cite id="21">outcomes are tracked and verified</cite>, there is no public theory of change or cost-effectiveness data.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization provides direct relief (food, water, health) to stabilize populations in crisis, assuming that immediate aid prevents further mortality and displacement.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that high program spending actually translates into meaningful life improvements for beneficiaries.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="3">24.2% growth rate</cite> and expanding operations in high-need areas like Gaza and Sudan, the organization can absorb significant additional capital.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Muslim Aid America's <cite id="6">93.2% program ratio</cite> is significantly higher than the <cite id="10">peer median of 85.2%</cite>.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="6">93.2% of its total expenses</cite> toward its core humanitarian programs, significantly exceeding the <cite id="10">peer program ratio median of 85.2%</cite>.
Muslim Aid America demonstrates high fiscal discipline with a <cite id="7">fundraising efficiency of $0.04 per $1 raised</cite>, allowing more capital to reach the field.
The charity has earned the <cite id="11">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, the highest level of recognition for non-profit data disclosure.

strengths_deep_dive: Muslim Aid America's financial health is characterized by rapid growth and operational leanliness. Between 2021 and 2023, revenue grew from <cite id="12">$16.9 million to over $26.1 million</cite>, a testament to its expanding donor base and capacity. This growth is managed by a <cite id="13">100% independent board of directors</cite>, ensuring strong oversight. The organization's ability to maintain a <cite id="6">93.2% program ratio</cite> while scaling suggests a highly scalable direct-service model that prioritizes beneficiary impact over institutional expansion.
rich_narrative.summary: Muslim Aid America is a humanitarian organization dedicated to assisting individuals suffering from hunger, disease, and illiteracy across the globe. Founded in <cite id="1">2012</cite>, the organization has rapidly scaled its operations to address acute crises and long-term development needs. In the most recent fiscal year, the organization reported a <cite id="2">total revenue of $26,177,076</cite>, representing a significant <cite id="3">3-year revenue CAGR of 24.2%</cite>. This growth supports a wide array of programs including <cite id="4">Emergency Relief, WASH, and Food Security</cite> across regions such as <cite id="5">Asia, the Middle East, and Africa</cite>. The organization operates with a high degree of financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="6">program expense ratio of 93.2%</cite>, which ensures that the vast majority of donor contributions are directed toward direct service delivery rather than administrative overhead. Furthermore, their fundraising model is exceptionally lean, costing only <cite id="7">$0.04 to raise every $1</cite>. While the organization does not currently facilitate zakat-specific funds, it provides a robust platform for <cite id="8">sadaqah-eligible giving</cite> to support vulnerable populations in <cite id="9">countries like Afghanistan, Gaza, and Somalia</cite>.
